result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony C. MARTINEZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court finds the defendant eligible for both the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program but not until after the first 12 months are served.

superMiscConds.notes: From case no: 14 CF 428 to Shopko in Manitowoc, WI, joint and several with Kayla Qualman.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony C. MARTINEZ

records.addlTxt: The petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
The district attorney objects to the Petition for Sentence Adjustment.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Transcript of sentencing hearing held on 01-14-15.
Copy of transript of sentencing hearing mailed to Registrar at Dodge Correctional Institution.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is hereby denied.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defendant in custody.
The parties argue the motion.
The Court denies the motion.  State to draft the order.
Minutes.
Manitowoc County Jail Discipline Reports. (2)
Motion for Bail Modification.
Motion hearing is set for 12-19-14 at 3:00 p.m.
Order to Deny Bail.

Defendant in custody.  
State moves to delete the enhancers of "within 1,000 feet of park and as repeater."  Motion granted.  Deliver Heroin - No contest plea.  Convicted.  
Counsel argue modification of bond.  Court denies the motion.
Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Sentencing hearing is set for 01-14-15 at 8:30 a.m.  Report is due by 01-07-15.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.
Minutes.
Letter from defendant to the Court.

Plea Date scheduled for 10-28-2014 @ 3:45 p.m. BR-1.
Rescheduled from 11-18-14.
Status Conference scheduled for 11-18-2014 @ 10:00 a.m. BR-1.

Order Modifying Defendant's Bail.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's bail is modified from $3,000.00 to $2,000.00.  All other conditions remain the same.  Further the defendant may be released for the purposes of attending any substance abuse treatment arranged through the Department of Corrections through ATTIC Correctional Services, and with consent of his probation officer.
Copy of order delivered to jail.

Defendant in custody.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with D.A. is set for 09-26-14 at 3:00 p.m.
MOTION FOR BAIL REDUCTION - 
The parties argue the motion.
The Court modifies bail to $2,000.00 cash.  If the defendant cannot post the cash bail, the Court will allow the defendant to attend AODA assessment and follow up counseling upon obtaining authorization from his probation officer to do so and providing proof to the court.
Attorney Snavely to draft the order.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.
Minutes.
Motion for Bail Modification.
Arraignment scheduled for 08-27-2014 @ 9:00 a.m. BR-1.
Judicial Assignment Order assigning Hon. Mark R. Rohrer as presiding judge.

Request for Substitution of Judge.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-06-14 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.
RE:  Deliver heroin within 1000 feet of park as repeater, on 03-31-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of deliver heroin within 1000 feet of park.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-04-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 cash.  Cash bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
